intro: Pouzolzia viminea var. fulgens, commonly known as the red-stemmed pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
